definition: see 咬緊牙關|咬紧牙关[yao3 jin3 ya2 guan1]
to bite/to nip
variant of 咬[yao3]
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
tooth/ivory/CL:顆|颗[ke1]
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
jaw/mandibular joint
see 拼命[pin1 ming4]
to clench one's teeth/to grind the teeth/gnaw
to resist (with great difficulty)
exerting all one's strength
to use all one's willpower (to do sth)/to hang in there
almost/nearly going to
to strive/to make an effort/to exert oneself
to breathe heavily like an ox (idiom)/to huff and puff
to be afraid/to be frightened
to ache/to be sore/to feel painful
to steel oneself/to harden one's heart
variant of 憤恨|愤恨[fen4 hen4]
doom/death/desperately
to make oneself do sth in spite of adversity, pain etc
